Same. To the point where anytime my husband takes a pic of me he immediately says ‚Äúdontworryimnotgonnapostit‚Äù or asks first but always seems like he expects a no. I‚Äôm really getting down recently seeing my face in zoom calls all the time. 

Actually seeing a video of myself caused one of my worst relapses back in 2018.

Accidentally laughing at an ED meme and hearing my husband say ‚Äúwhat?‚Äù from across the room is both a fear and a regular occurance lol. I usually just say ‚Äúoh it‚Äôs just a dumb animal crossing meme‚Äù or something.
You right
Lmao can you image a big muscle man and someone asks you what Del is short for and you gotta say Delicious? Lol, I do know a Del whose name is short for Delbert though so idk what‚Äôs worse.
Thissssss. Praising her for weight loss is acceptable as long as that was the goal she set out the achieve and it clearly is. She worked hard for that body and the backlash she‚Äôs getting is insane.

My five-year-old nephew goes to school with a boy who is legitimately named Delicious. I don‚Äôt understand.

I thought my childhood bullying was bad enough as a girl named Stevie. My name is cool now that I‚Äôm an adult but the amount of ‚Äúha ha ur name is Steve and ur a boyyyyyyyy‚Äù got really tiring in elementary school. But just imagine being named Delicious.
Those lil legs are killing me omggggg
Clothing is not made to be constantly rubbed for however many hours a day you‚Äôre wearing it. It usually takes a few weeks or months of regular wear to get the holes

While it does give you diarrhea it also makes you bloat at the same time so it‚Äôs not even worth it. I have a soy intolerance and lactose intolerance and intentionally triggering either one doesn‚Äôt make me feel skinnier. I wish it did but it just kinda sucks. You fart and bloat a lot on top of the pooping.

When I worked in a grocery store someone stole my debit card info and tried to buy $9000 worth of Apple products. The transaction was declined and my bank called me to tell me about the fraud because I only had $20 in my account and never had more than $300 even on pay day so they knew it couldn‚Äôt have been me lmao.
I‚Äôm really digging her chaotic energy so far lol
I feel like she‚Äôs more cheeky and mischievous than mean, lol. I get a chaotic energy from her and I‚Äôm living for it lol

I agree. Also, after being disordered so long I have no idea how to eat intuitively. I don‚Äôt know how to eat like a normal human. I need guidelines or I go off the rails in either direction. 

I saw a youtuber (don‚Äôt remember who, maybe Unnatural Vegan??) who said you need a basic understanding of nutrition to do intuitive eating right, and if you‚Äôre disordered you shouldn‚Äôt be doing it because your perception of what is normal to eat is warped. Now that I think of it, it‚Äôs probably Unnatural Vegan because she‚Äôs talked about her past struggle with bulimia before.
It‚Äôs even better because she came from my friend‚Äôs town. I let fate decide who would move in and she was like hey I moved from your bud‚Äôs island to do crime.
Bruh, my jeans get holes in that area because my thighs touch and rub away the fabric . . . But judging by this guy‚Äôs question he probably doesn‚Äôt understand friction too well.

Mine is super close too so I just did a path branching off to either side and put the interesting stuff around it instead of before it. I think mine is a little more than 3 blocks, but still too close for a cool entrance. I wish I‚Äôd thought of that when I picked my map.

Same, some noises that aren‚Äôt my triggers will become triggering if they‚Äôre repetitive enough. 
That sucks that they can‚Äôt be considerate. Like I get that people can‚Äôt help making noise when they eat sometimes but intentionally making a trigger noise is something else. If someone close to me makes a trigger noise and they realize they did it they‚Äôll usually apologize and try to minimize it. Most of the time anyway, and when they don‚Äôt it‚Äôs usually that they forgot/didn‚Äôt realize.

Aw man that sucks :( 

It seems like they hate wfh because there‚Äôs less control on their part. Wfh employees generally have more flexibility, which I have noticed in the almost 2 months I‚Äôve been doing it. We used to have a wfh option for like maybe one day where you didn‚Äôt feel well but felt like working or if you had car problems, etc. Then they took it away from us because ‚Äúsecurity issues.‚Äù 

Eventually we got it back for weather issues - and only because I got into a car accident trying to come to work in the snow (no injuries thankfully, just hella expensive repairs) My direct managers (who are great and empathetic people) had to shove my accident into the higher-ups faces for almost a year before they relented and gave us the option again.

True, hopefully he finds something cool. I honestly think a lot of us deserve better than what we‚Äôre given here but I‚Äôm trying to stay til five years so I can make up for the fact that I don‚Äôt have a degree with a nice chunk of experience.

Mental illness is cool in that it‚Äôs completely irrational and doesn‚Äôt make sense but we still can‚Äôt help how it affects us. It‚Äôs weird how certain circumstances can make the same noise more or less triggering. Like why did this sound make me want to murder yesterday, but hearing it in a different setting under different circumstances is fine? 

Also I‚Äôm sorry you‚Äôre not immune to dog noises, that sucks :(

Exactly! The security thing was what my company used when they laid most of those people off.  They gave them advance notice too (months of it) and now they‚Äôre saying they‚Äôre considering allowing permanent wfh. But they‚Äôre not reversing any lay-offs for the people who haven‚Äôt hit their departure date yet. I feel so bad for that guy on my team having to listen to that and knowing the only reason he‚Äôs leaving the company is because he works from home.

Idk man, my company has been seriously anti-wfh in the past and had laid off a lot of wfh employees specifically for that reason. One of our best people is leaving us soon because he was wfh going back years before this. Like they were willing to cut a serious asset to our team because he wasn‚Äôt in one of our offices. This pandemic shit has really shifted their perspective since they had to basically redo the network infrastructure in a week to allow us all to wfh.

I‚Äôm honestly considering working from home permanently if my company will let me. I work in internet marketing and SEO, so there‚Äôs not really a reason for me to be in the office. My role isn‚Äôt customer-facing, so why not?

Omg the ice chewing. My husband does it and it drives me nuts. It‚Äôs an unconscious habit for him so he doesn‚Äôt realize he‚Äôs doing it until I ask him to please stop or do it somewhere else. But meanwhile dog noises don‚Äôt bother me (except high pitched barking that won‚Äôt stop, that I don‚Äôt like).
Saaaame. Like the dogs slorping away at the water dish or licking themselves loudly doesn‚Äôt trigger me at all but an adult human being eating in my vicinity is like instant anxiety/rage.
Yepppp. My husband has a belly and I still think he‚Äôs hot. Idk why I can‚Äôt think that way about myself but whatevs lol.

It‚Äôs definitely a thing. In an environment where I expect the noise, noises will be fine, like if someone is eating and I‚Äôm ALSO eating, it‚Äôs less annoying (as long as they‚Äôre eating normally and not smacking or chewing with their mouth open.) 

If I‚Äôm not eating and someone around me is, instant trigger. Like when I‚Äôm at the table working and my husband decides to have a snack or a later lunch right across from me - big no. If we‚Äôre having a meal together, usually not triggered. 

Sometimes I‚Äôm triggered by my own noises, but it‚Äôs usually less so if I‚Äôm expecting it or if I‚Äôm making it.

Recipe:

1/2 crust Brooklyn Bred thin crust pizza crust, divided 

3 slices Upton‚Äôs Naturals seitan bacon 

2 slices tomato 

50g mushrooms saut√©ed in a lil grape seed oil

3tbsp vegan shredded cheddar (I used the 365 brand)

lil bit of spinach (mine didn‚Äôt even weigh a gram so not 
worth counting) 


I toasted the crust a lil and then used the microwave to melt the cheese onto the bread. Cooked the seitan and mushrooms in the same pan. Be careful, ingredients like to slide out!

Right, you run into problems when you start trying to police other people‚Äôs diets. For me feeling good about what I‚Äôm eating includes knowing what I eat is cruelty-free, but not everyone seems to care about that part and I can‚Äôt make them.

I completely agree. I‚Äôve watched enough of UnnaturalVegan plugging those raw vegan diets into chronometer your know how deficient it is. You have to eat cooked foods on a vegan diet to get everything you need, and take some kind of B12 supplement. Vitamin D is also one most of us need, even omnis.
Personally, I'm here for a good time, not a long time. As long as I feel good/healthy eating what I'm eating, I don't really worry about cancer risk.

Dude my workplace is the same. The only other scenario where you can wfh is if someone in your household is symptomatic. They're claiming it's because the VPN can handle everyone being on it despite the fact that we're a global company. Supposedly the infrastructure is being developed to allow it. I do have to give them credit for that, at least. They were working through the weekend to make sure we could all do it if offices had to close. 

While I understand the need to wfh if you can't get childcare (all the daycares are closed too), I think they should have also sent anyone with an autoimmune disease or other chronic illness home as well.

My work did this too. You can pretty much only WFH if your child's school is closed and you can't find alternative childcare. Other scenarios include traveling to a high-risk area or if someone in your household is symptomatic. I didn't see anything in the WFH scenarios about being a high-risk person due to auto-immune diseases or other chronic illness.

This is speaking as a vegan - raw vegans seriously need to shut the fuck up. Honestly as a whole community we need to stop pretending it's the healthiest diet out there. You can be healthy on ANY diet. Veganism is an ethical philosophy, not a cure all super healthy superfood diet. People like that make all of us look batshit insane when most of us just want people to stop asking us what we would do if we were trapped on a deserted island with a pig.

I'm also in a similar line of work (SEO), and my job can easily be done remotely. The problem is that our VPN network isn't prepared for EVERYONE to be at home. We're a global company, and it's not equipped to handle that many people working from home. It was previously only for employees in the office I'm in or the Canada offices for snowstorms. The main office is in Florida so they don't get that option. So now everyone is trying to set up an infrastructure for it. So far the only WFH people are those that have children and can't get alternative child care. Being childless, that means I'm in the office today. It's pretty much a ghost town here. 

It's wild that we aren't equipped for office closures like this, but then again, I guess no one expects ALL of the offices to need to close. The closest to that is ONE office closing for a gas leak.

I looked at a few recipes for chickpea ‚Äútuna‚Äù salad, and none of them had everything I would have wanted so I decided to wing it. It came out amazing and pretty similar to tuna (not exactly like it, obviously) so here‚Äôs my recipe:

You‚Äôll need:
-1 can of chickpeas, drained, rinsed, and mashed (I used a food processor but fork mashing works)

-vegan mayo (I used Hellman‚Äôs veganaise)

-fresh lemon juice to taste 

-celery, chopped very fine (as much as you want, depending on how crunchy you like it)

- red onion, chopped fine (optional, I used like a tablespoon and a smidge because I wanted that flavor)

-nori (I used 3 sheets of Annie Chun‚Äôs seaweed snacks in sea salt flavor), chopped up fine

-celery seed

-garlic powder

-salt

-pepper


Putting it together:
1. Take your mashed chick peas and mix some vegan mayo into it until you achieve your desired texture. I like juuuuust enough mayo to make it not dry. Two spoonfuls with a smallish serving spoon was enough for me. Best bet is to add a bit of mayo, mix with a fork, and repeat until satisfied.
2. Throw in your nori, celery, and red onion
3. Squeeze in some fresh lemon juice
4. Add the celery seed, garlic powder, salt, and pepper to taste.
5. Mix it all up with a fork and make a sandwich! I put it on pita with some cucumber slices.

My husband does not have misophonia, but I do. For his part, he tries to eat kinda far away from me, unless it's a family meal. If he's snacking and I'm not eating he'll do it in a different room. 

For my part, the only thing I can do is regulate my breathing and focus on something else. I've actually gotten to the point where most of his noises don't bother me as much. Like a mild twinge. I still can't handle the chewing, but like I said, he tries to put distance between us. In restaurants and stuff the background noise drowns it out enough for me. And if we're eating at the same table we'll talk or have the TV on or something to give me something else to tune into.
